Description: Part of the side and base from a vessel of coarse marl clay. The fabric contains a large amount of grit, chiefly quartz grains. The base was flat and the side rose almost vertically. The interior and, to a lesser extent, the base are coated with a layer of blue frit and it is likely that the fragment comes from a vessel used in the preparation of this material.
Curator's comments: W.M.F. Petrie, Tanis ii, Nebesheh and Defenneh, p. 75 § 72: "A piece of a pot of refractory material, in which blue frit has been prepared in the furnace, for blue paint, was also found in the camp; it is just like what occured in the sacarab factory at Naukratis, and points to a manufacture of blue-glazed articles". See also London, BM, reg. no.1890,0610.39, and Boston, MFA, 87.152 (deacc.) also from Tell Dafana. See also the sample of blue pigment (?) 1890,0619.43
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 75 § 72)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.115, p.227, pl.69)
